Welcome to Cancer Patients Support System

Join us in providing care, guidance, and support to cancer patients and their families.Together, we aim to offer emotional comfort, reliable resources, and a compassionate community to help them navigate every step of their journey.

About Us

We are a non-profit organization dedicated to providing care, awareness, and assistance to cancer patients, survivors, and their families. Our mission is to build a compassionate community where no one has to face cancer alone.

We focus on

  • Sharing awareness blogs and resources to educate and empower.
  • Offering a donation platform that supports patients in need.
  • Connecting volunteers and caregivers with patients for emotional and practical support.
  • Creating a safe space of hope and encouragement for patients and families.

As a non-profit, every effort we make is driven by compassion, community support, and the belief that together, we can ease the challenges faced by those fighting cancer.

Support

Medical Guidance

Connecting cancer patients with trusted doctors, reputed hospitals, advanced treatment resources,and holistic care solutions because access to the right support can make the journey easier and stronger.

Emotional Care

We provide counseling, guidance, and a supportive community to bring comfort, strength, and hope to patients and their families.

Financial Help

We empower lives through fundraising initiatives that cover not just medical care, but also essential needs like food, clothing, and education for children of cancer-affected families.

Join as a Volunteer

‚ÄúTogether, we create moments of strength, dignity, and hope proving that no one has to face cancer alone.‚Äù

Stand with us to uplift cancer patients because support isn't always about money. Your time, kindness, and presence can make every journey brighter.

Cancer Awareness & Types Guide

‚ÄúLearn ways to reduce risks and take care of your health with early care for lifelong health.‚Äù

Cancer Types & Their Symptoms

1. Carcinomas

Meaning: Cancer that begins in epithelial cells. Most common type of cancer.

Origin: Skin, lungs, breast, prostate, colon, stomach, pancreas.

Examples: Breast cancer, Lung cancer, Prostate cancer.

Symptoms:

  • Lumps or swelling
  • Blood in sputum/stool/urine
  • Chronic cough or breathing problems
  • Skin sores or patches that don‚Äôt heal
2. Sarcomas

Meaning: Cancer in connective tissues. Less common but aggressive.

Origin: Bones, muscles, fat, cartilage, blood vessels.

Examples: Osteosarcoma, Liposarcoma, Rhabdomyosarcoma.

Symptoms:

  • Painless lump under skin or deep tissue
  • Bone pain, swelling, or fractures
  • Abdominal pain or fullness
3. Leukemias

Meaning: Cancer of blood-forming tissues (bone marrow).

Origin: Bone marrow & blood.

Examples: ALL, AML, CML.

Symptoms:

  • Persistent tiredness, weakness
  • Frequent infections
  • Easy bleeding, bruising, nosebleeds
  • Bone/joint pain
  • Swollen liver/spleen
4. Lymphomas

Meaning: Cancer of the lymphatic system.

Origin: Lymph nodes, spleen, thymus, bone marrow.

Examples: Hodgkin lymphoma, Non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

Symptoms:

  • Enlarged lymph nodes
  • Night sweats
  • Fever, fatigue
  • Unexplained weight loss
  • Persistent itching
5. Melanomas

Meaning: Deadliest form of skin cancer from melanocytes.

Origin: Skin, eyes.

Examples: Cutaneous melanoma, Ocular melanoma.

Symptoms (ABCDE rule):

  • Asymmetry ‚Äì uneven halves
  • Border ‚Äì irregular edges
  • Color ‚Äì multiple shades
  • Diameter ‚Äì larger than 6 mm
  • Evolving ‚Äì changing in size, bleeding
6. CNS Cancers

Meaning: Cancer in brain or spinal cord tissues.

Origin: Brain, spinal cord, meninges.

Examples: Glioblastoma, Astrocytoma, Meningioma.

Symptoms:

  • Persistent headaches
  • Seizures
  • Vision or hearing problems
  • Difficulty speaking or walking
  • Memory/personality changes
  • Weakness or paralysis

During & After Cancer: Healthy Living

Learn how nutrition, exercise, mental wellness, and preventive care can help survivors thrive during and after cancer.

üåø During & After Cancer: Healthy Living

Cancer treatment is a life-changing journey. Healthy living empowers survivors not only to heal but also to thrive.

ü•ó Nutrition for Healing and Strength
  • Fruits & Vegetables: Rich in antioxidants that protect cells from damage.
  • Lean Proteins: Fish, chicken, beans, and dairy for tissue repair.
  • Whole Grains: Oats, brown rice, and quinoa provide lasting energy.
  • Healthy Fats: Olive oil, avocados, and flaxseeds for heart and brain health.
  • Hydration: Keeps energy up and supports detoxification.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Physical Activity for Recovery
  • Gentle stretching and short walks during treatment.
  • Yoga, swimming, or light strength training after recovery.
  • Improves sleep, reduces fatigue, and lowers recurrence risk.
üß† Mental and Emotional Wellness
  • Counseling to reduce anxiety and stress.
  • Support groups for encouragement and connection.
  • Mindfulness practices like meditation and journaling.
  • Creative healing through art, music, or gardening.
üò¥ Rest, Sleep, and Recovery

Prioritize rest and proper sleep routines. Balance activity with downtime for optimal healing.

ü©∫ Medical Care and Regular Follow-ups

Attend checkups, routine scans, and vaccinations. Track symptoms in a health diary and report any unusual changes.

üö´ Avoid Harmful Habits

Quit smoking, limit alcohol, and reduce processed foods. Replace cravings with healthy snacks.

üå∏ Social and Spiritual Support

Lean on family, friends, or faith-based practices for strength. Volunteering and staying socially connected builds positivity and purpose.

üåü Final Thoughts

Healthy living during and after cancer is about more than survival‚Äîit is about creating a fulfilling, empowered life.
